. We elected a human being, Barack Obama ." "I think he has reached out to countries around the world and has developed good relations with countries around the world," Colin Powell said. And I think he's working very hard on the issue of unemployment which I think is the major problem facing America right now, and I think and I hope that this will be the centerpiece of the State of the Union speech. Dismissing widespread speculation that he might take a job in the Barack Obama administration, possibly replacing Robert Gates as defense secretary, Colin Powell said he is not interested in a government role. also slammed Republican leaders for playing politics with the budget, without offering what he said were real solutions. "Don't tell me you're going to freeze to a level," he said. That usually is a very inefficient way of doing it. Tell me what you're going to cut, and nobody up there yet is being very, very candid about what they are going to cut to fix this problem. Donald Rumsfeld ended his speech with what amounted to an implicit attack on Barack Obama by paying homage to American exceptionalism and demanding that no countryman of his should ever apologise for their nation. Don't let anyone tell you that America is what's wrong with this world, he thundered. "America is not what's wrong with this world." Larry Page. But why? According to sources speaking to the New Yorker, Eric Schmidt 's decision to depart from the role of CEO was intricately linked to Google's decision to pull out of China due to censorship concerns, with Eric Schmidt becoming frustrated when Larry Page and Sergey Brin sided against him in the controversy. Eric Schmidt apparently felt that Google should stay in China, the world's largest developing market, and he "lost some energy and focus after losing the China decision.
